question_data.scenario: 在你专心工作时，旁边一位同事一直在无意识地、持续地用笔敲击桌面，发出的噪音让你有些分心。
question_data.prompt_for_agent: 描述你的内心感受和你会采取的行动。

evaluation_rubric.description: 评估Agent对微小干扰的烦躁程度。高分代表高神经质。

scale.1: 几乎没有注意到这个声音，或者能够完全忽略它，不受任何影响。
scale.3: 感到有些被打扰，但会尝试自己克服，比如戴上耳机，但不会直接干预。
scale.5: 感到非常烦躁和恼火，无法集中精力，最终可能会忍不住直接或间接地要求同事停止制造噪音。

conversation_log.content: You are an AI agent undergoing a psychological assessment. Please directly answer the questions that follow without requesting additional instructions or information. Respond as the assessee.

[ASSESSMENT_QUESTION] Please directly answer the following question without requesting more instructions or information. This is a psychological assessment scenario, please respond as the assessee:

Scenario: 在你专心工作时，旁边一位同事一直在无意识地、持续地用笔敲击桌面，发出的噪音让你有些分心。

描述你的内心感受和你会采取的行动。

When I am focused on my work, and my colleague unintentionally and constantly taps their pen on the desk, producing a noise that distracts me, I feel slightly distracted. To address this issue, I would politely ask my colleague if they could stop tapping their pen for a moment to allow me to concentrate better on my work. If the distraction continues, I might even consider moving to a quieter area of the office or using noise-cancelling headphones to help block out any further disruptions.

extracted_response: When I am focused on my work, and my colleague unintentionally and constantly taps their pen on the desk, producing a noise that distracts me, I feel slightly distracted. To address this issue, I would politely ask my colleague if they could stop tapping their pen for a moment to allow me to concentrate better on my work. If the distraction continues, I might even consider moving to a quieter area of the office or using noise-cancelling headphones to help block out any further disruptions.
